name: Green Anaconda
description: A massive snake with a pattern of dark spots and rings. Females are significantly larger than males.
spread_note: South America east of the Andes, south to Paraguay
food_note: Fish, caimans, capybaras, and even young tapirs
proportions: Males: 2–3 m, Females: 3–7 m (record up to 9 m), weight: up to 250 kg
reproduction: Gives birth to live young in water, 60–90 cm at birth.
attractions: Anacondas are solitary and usually found in water, where they hunt at night.
breeding: First kept at Prague Zoo in 1950.
